texts.label: text
texts.orig: In some situations, the system time zone will be different than the one in MySQL, even though MySQL is set to use the system time zone. This normally means that a user has changed the system time zone, but they haven't started MySQL to cause it to change as well.
texts.text: In some situations, the system time zone will be different than the one in MySQL, even though MySQL is set to use the system time zone. This normally means that a user has changed the system time zone, but they haven't started MySQL to cause it to change as well.

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
$ date
Sun Jul  1 11:32:56 CDT 2007
mysql> show variables like '%time_zone%';
+------------------+--------+
| Variable_name    | Value  |
+------------------+--------+
| system_time_zone | PDT    |
| time_zone        | SYSTEM |
+------------------+--------+
2 rows in set (0.00 sec)
texts.text:
$ date
Sun Jul  1 11:32:56 CDT 2007
mysql> show variables like '%time_zone%';
+------------------+--------+
| Variable_name    | Value  |
+------------------+--------+
| system_time_zone | PDT    |
| time_zone        | SYSTEM |
+------------------+--------+
2 rows in set (0.00 sec)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If you find yourself in this situation, just restart MySQL and the situation should be fixed:
texts.text: If you find yourself in this situation, just restart MySQL and the situation should be fixed:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
mysql> show variables like '%time_zone%';
+------------------+--------+
| Variable_name    | Value  |
+------------------+--------+
| system_time_zone | CDT    |
| time_zone        | SYSTEM |
+------------------+--------+
2 rows in set (0.00 sec)
texts.text:
mysql> show variables like '%time_zone%';
+------------------+--------+
| Variable_name    | Value  |
+------------------+--------+
| system_time_zone | CDT    |
| time_zone        | SYSTEM |
+------------------+--------+
2 rows in set (0.00 sec)
